title: Microsoft Word - un_missions_20130131.doc
body:
LIST OF UN Field Missions 
1. BNUB United Nations Integrated Office in Burundi 
2. BINUCA    United Nations Integrated Peace-building Office in the Central African Republic 
3. MINURSO  United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara 
4. MINUSTAH  United Nations Stabilization Mission in Haiti 
5. MONUSCO  United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the 
Congo  
6.    UNAMA United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan  
7. UNAMI United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq  
8. UNAMID United Nations-African Union Mission in Darfur 
9. UNDOF United Nations Disengagement Observer Force  
10. UNFICYP United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus  
11. UNIFIL United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon  
12. UNIOGBIS United Nations integrated Peace-Building Office in Guinea-Bissau 
13. UNIPSIL United Nations Integrated Peace building office in Sierra Leon 
14. UNLB United Nations Logistics Base, Brindisi  
15. UNMIK United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo  
16. UNMIL United Nations Mission in Liberia  
17. UNMOGIP United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan 
18. UNOCI United Nations Operation in Côte d'Ivoire 
19. UNOCA United Nations Regional Office for Central Africa  
20. UNOWA United Nations Office for West Africa 
21. UNPOS United Nations Political Office for Somalia 
22. UNRCCA         United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia 
23. UNSCO Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process 
24. UNSCOL Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for Lebanon 
25. UNTSO United Nations Truce Supervision Organisation 
26. UNSOA United Nations Support Office for AMISOM 
27. UNISFA United Nations Interim Security Force in Abyei 
 28. UNMISS United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan 
 29. UNSB-V United Nations Support Base, Valencia 
 30. UNSMIL United Nations Support Mission in Libya   
 31. UNOM  United Nations Office in Mali 
  
  
                                                                                                                                  31 January 2013

author: Willem.Tahon

title:
SECRETARY-GENERAL WELCOMES RENEWED UNITED STATES COMMITMENT TO
ENGAGEMENT WITH UNITED NATIONS
docs.description: SECRETARY-GENERAL WELCOMES RENEWED UNITED STATES COMMITMENT TO ENGAGEMENT WITH UNITED NATIONS
body:
13 August 2009 Secretary-General SG/SM/12413
 Department of Public Information • News and Media Division • New York 
 


 
 
 Secretary-General welcomes renewed United States commitment to engagement  
 
 with United Nations      
 
 The following statement was issued today by the Spokesperson for UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon: 
 
 The Secretary-General welcomes the commitment to renewed United States engagement with the United Nations as recently stressed by United States Ambassador Susan Rice on behalf of the Obama Administration.  United States leadership at the United Nations is essential, given the complex array of challenges facing the international community, from climate change, to issues of peace and security, to human rights.  Providing the resources necessary to allow the United Nations to undertake the jobs asked of it is also essential.  Therefore the Secretary-General particularly welcomes the recent United States contributions to the United Nations provided by the Obama Administration and the United States Congress.    
 
 The Secretary-General is committed to continuing the reform process and looks forward to working with the  United States, and all the   Member   States of the United Nations, to ensure that the Organization can meet the demands asked of it by Member States in the most effective, efficient and accountable way possible. 
 
 * *** * 
 

 
 For information media • not an official record
